name: Swami Vivekananda International Convention Center (SVICC)
description: Mauritius’s major convention venue on the Port Louis–Pailles corridor, hosting expos, concerts, and conferences with large halls and parking.

entry_points.name: Main Entrance & Parking
entry_points.access_notes: Event days can be crowded; arrive early.

reviews.summary: Spacious venue with good acoustics; traffic at peak events.

advisories.safety: Follow venue directions; keep valuables secure.

name: Rajiv Gandhi Science Center
description: Interactive science museum with hands-on exhibits, planetarium-style shows, and student workshops.

reviews.summary: Great for kids and science enthusiasts; friendly staff.

name: Bain des Dames Beach
description: Urban seaside spot west of Port Louis harbor with local vibe and sunset views.

location.address: Bain des Dames, Port Louis, Mauritius

reviews.summary: Relaxed, authentic feel; not a resort beach.

name: Les Salines Garden
description: Green space between Caudan/Les Salines with lawns, paths, and occasional community events.

reviews.summary: Pleasant lawns near waterfront; handy for picnics.

additional_info.notes: Bring water and hats on hot days.

name: Tortoise Park (Les Salines Garden)
description: Small enclosure with giant tortoises within the Les Salines green area—popular with families.

prerequisites.notes: Feeding rules may apply—follow on-site notices.

reviews.summary: Kids love it; quick, cute stop.

additional_info.notes: Short visit pairs well with the park.

name: Kwan Tee Pagoda
description: Historic Chinese temple near the waterfront, with colorful altars and incense—a cultural anchor of Port Louis.

reviews.summary: Serene and historic; photogenic interiors.

name: Odysseo – Oceanarium
description: Modern oceanarium with Indian Ocean species, walkthrough tunnels, and educational exhibits beside the harbor.

reviews.summary: Excellent displays and layout; family favorite.

name: Marie Reine de la Paix
description: Open-air terraced chapel on a hillside with sweeping views of Port Louis—popular for sunsets and ceremonies.

entry_points.name: Stair Access
entry_points.access_notes: Steep steps; bring water on hot days.

reviews.summary: Iconic city overlook; peaceful atmosphere.

advisories.safety: Mind steps when descending after dark.

name: Victoria Urban Terminal
description: Modern transit and retail hub adjoining Port Louis’s main bus interchange with shops, eateries, and pedestrian links.

location.address: Victoria Station area, Port Louis, Mauritius

prerequisites.notes: Good link to waterfront on foot.

reviews.summary: Clean, convenient, and central; crowded at rush hour.

name: Caudan Waterfront
description: Port Louis’s waterfront district with shopping, dining, marina views, and museums—home to the city’s famous Umbrella Square.

reviews.summary: Must-see waterfront with food, shops, and photo spots.

additional_info.notes: Great base for exploring central Port Louis.

name: Umbrella Square
description: Colorful canopy of suspended umbrellas at Caudan Waterfront—popular Instagram spot.

prerequisites.notes: Best light mid-morning or late afternoon.

reviews.summary: Vibrant and fun; always busy.

name: Blue Penny Museum
description: Museum famous for the rare 1847 Mauritius ‘Post Office’ stamps and island history exhibits.

prerequisites.notes: Stamps lit for limited minutes each hour.

reviews.summary: Compact, high-quality exhibits; a philatelic gem.

name: Mauritius Postal Museum
description: Historic postal building and museum near the waterfront showcasing mail heritage and stamp history.

reviews.summary: Charming heritage stop; niche but interesting.

additional_info.notes: Combine with Blue Penny for a theme trail.

name: Windmill Museum (Caudan)
description: A small exhibit recalling early wind-powered industry on the waterfront precinct.

reviews.summary: Tiny but quirky stop near the mall.

name: Intercontinental Slavery Museum (ICSM)
description: Museum dedicated to the memory and history of slavery in Mauritius and the region, with rotating exhibits and education programs.

prerequisites.notes: Check current venue and hours; evolving institution.

reviews.summary: Powerful storytelling; reflective experience.

additional_info.notes: Combine with Aapravasi Ghat for context.

name: Aapravasi Ghat World Heritage Site
description: UNESCO site marking the landing point of indentured laborers; museum exhibits and preserved structures on the harbor edge.

reviews.summary: Essential site for Mauritius’s identity and migration history.

name: Signal Mountain (Montagne des Signaux)
description: Popular city hike with a paved road to a viewpoint overlooking Port Louis and the harbor.

entry_points.name: Trail Start (road gate)
entry_points.access_notes: Steady incline; bring water and cap.

prerequisites.notes: Early morning and late afternoon are best.

reviews.summary: Iconic, accessible city hike with big views.

name: Natural History Museum (Mauritius Institute)
description: Classic museum with exhibits on island fauna, flora, geology, and dodo reconstructions.

location.address: Jardin de la Compagnie area, Port Louis

reviews.summary: Charming and informative; good for families.

name: Les Jardins de la Compagnie (Company Gardens)
description: Historic central park shaded by giant banyans and statues; a classic Port Louis respite.

reviews.summary: Green oasis in the city; great banyan trees.

advisories.safety: Beware falling twigs after strong wind.

name: Photographic Museum of Mauritius
description: Specialist museum preserving early photography of Mauritius, equipment, and rare prints.

reviews.summary: Run by passionate curators; rich historic images.

name: St James Cathedral
description: Anglican cathedral with colonial-era architecture and a peaceful garden setting.

reviews.summary: Calm and historic; short, reflective visit.

name: St Louis Cathedral
description: The Roman Catholic cathedral of Port Louis with significant religious and architectural heritage.

reviews.summary: Impressive interior and history.

name: Champ de Mars Racecourse
description: Historic racecourse (since 1812) ringed by mountains—Saturday races draw big crowds and vibrant atmosphere.

reviews.summary: Electric atmosphere; bring sun protection.

additional_info.notes: Vendors and food stalls on race days.

advisories.safety: Keep distance from rails and running horses.

name: Tombeau Malartic
description: Memorial tomb of French Governor Anne Joseph Hippolyte de Maures de Malartic near the racecourse grounds.

location.address: Near Champ de Mars, Port Louis

reviews.summary: Historic point of interest; brief visit.

name: Le Dauguet (Green Corridor)
description: Forest corridor and recreation area on the northern flank of Port Louis, with tracks leading to small cascades.

reviews.summary: Shady walks close to town; peaceful.

name: Cascade Dauguet
description: Small waterfall reachable via short tracks from the Le Dauguet green corridor.

reviews.summary: Quiet, refreshing stop; slippery stones.

name: Nam Shun Fooy Koon Pagoda
description: Historic Chinese pagoda in Port Louis’s Chinatown with ornate woodwork and ancestral altars.

reviews.summary: Peaceful temple; cultural insight.

name: Citadelle (Fort Adelaide)
description: 19th-century hilltop fort overlooking Port Louis with panoramic views and historic ramparts.

reviews.summary: Top city view; breezy and photogenic.

advisories.safety: Keep to marked areas on ramparts.

name: China Town (Port Louis)
description: Historic quarter with Chinese groceries, eateries, temples, and annual street art festival.

location.address: Royal Road area, Port Louis, Mauritius

reviews.summary: Tasty, vibrant, and photogenic.

name: China Town Gate
description: Decorative gateway marking the entrance to Port Louis’s Chinatown.

reviews.summary: Iconic photo landmark.

additional_info.notes: Great start for a food crawl.

name: Street & Art Murals (China Town)
description: Colorful murals across alleyways and façades, expanding yearly with festivals.

prerequisites.notes: Wander side streets to discover more.

reviews.summary: Vibrant and evolving; great for photos.

name: Sir Abdul Razack Mohamed Garden
description: Named section within the Plaine Verte area honoring a key Mauritian statesman.

reviews.summary: Quiet corner to sit and reflect.

additional_info.notes: Pair with a stroll across Plaine Verte.

name: Sunnirazvi Garden
description: Small green pocket associated with the surrounding community, used for casual meetups and kids' play.

reviews.summary: Simple neighborhood green.

name: Priest's Peak (Montagne du Prêtre)
description: One of the lesser-known peaks on the Port Louis mountain rim, offering rugged trails and wide views.

entry_points.name: Trail Spur
entry_points.access_notes: Unmarked sections; go with experienced hikers.

reviews.summary: Rewarding views; rough paths.

advisories.safety: Avoid in heavy rain or strong wind.

name: Sockalingum Meenatchee Ammen Kovil
description: Prominent Tamil kovil (temple) in Port Louis known for colorful gopuram and annual religious festivals.

reviews.summary: Vibrant and welcoming; ornate carvings.

name: Piton Jacob's Peak (Piton Jacob)
description: A lesser-visited summit in the Port Louis chain, offering quiet trails and city-to-sea views.

reviews.summary: Quiet alternative to Signal; raw trails.

name: Jumbo Riche Terre
description: Large hypermarket and retail complex just north of Port Louis—useful for supplies, ATMs, and quick meals.

location.address: Riche Terre, Port Louis Region, Mauritius

reviews.summary: Convenient and comprehensive; peak-hour queues.

additional_info.notes: Good pit stop before road trips north.
